intro: Brodiaea coronaria var. macropoda, commonly known as the large-flowered brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open grasslands and rocky habitats.
